VPN 0 or transport VPN carries control traffic over secure DTLS or TLS connections between vSmart controllers and vEdge routers, and between vSmart controllers and vBond orchestrators VPN 0 . https://www.bing.com/ck/a?!&&p=5acc1b101683b550JmltdHM9MTY5NTUxMzYwMCZpZ3VpZD0xNGJjNzA4Mi1kODllLTZiYjQtMDIxZC02MzE3ZDkzNTZhZDcmaW5zaWQ9NTM0Mg&ptn=3&hsh=3&fclid=14bc7082-d89e-6bb4-021d-6317d9356ad7&psq=DTLS+and+TCP+connections+between+vsmart+and+vbond&u=a1aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY2lzY28uY29tL2MvZW4vdXMvdGQvZG9jcy9yb3V0ZXJzL3Nkd2FuL2NvbmZpZ3VyYXRpb24vc2VnbWVudGF0aW9uL3ZFZGdlLTIwLXgvc2VnbWVudGF0aW9uLWJvb2svc2VnbWVudGF0aW9uLmh0bWw&ntb=1

VPN 0 on a WAN edge device is utilized to first connect to VBond to retrieve information through the REST-API (GET) procedure, via DTLS /TLS.

Answer [B]

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/system-interface/vedge-20-x/systems-interfaces-book/configure-interfaces.html

VPN 0—Transport VPN, which carries control traffic via the configured WAN transport interfaces. Initially, VPN 0 contains all of a device's interfaces except for the management interface, and all interfaces are disabled.
vEdges never build IP Sec tunnels to vSmart/vManage. IP Sec tunnels are stablished only between vEdges. A ad B are ruled out

choices.A: It carries control traffic over secure IPsec connections between vSmart controllers and vEdge routers, and between vEdge and vManager.
choices.C: It carries control traffic over secure DTLS or TLS connections between vSmart controllers and vEdge routers, and between vSmart and vBond.
choices.B: It carries control traffic over secure IPsec connections between vSmart controllers and vEdge routers, and between vSmart and vBond.
choices.D: It carries out-of-band network management traffic among the Cisco SD-WAN devices in the overlay network.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of `vpn 0` in the configuration template when onboarding a WAN Edge node?
Which value of the IPsec rekey timer must be set by the engineer for an OMP graceful restart value set for 24 hours?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In Cisco SD-WAN, when setting the OMP graceful restart timer, the IPsec rekey timer must be set to at least twice the OMP graceful restart interval.
 • OMP graceful restart = 24 hours
 • Required IPsec rekey timer = 2 × 24 = 48 hours

This ensures that IPsec tunnels remain valid long enough during the OMP restart window to prevent tunnel teardown.

Selected Answer: D
The default OMP graceful restart value is 12 hours and can be set to a maximum of 604,800 seconds, which is equivalent to 7 days. The IPsec rekey timer is set to 24 hours by default, and although both timers are configurable, the IPsec rekey timer must be at least two times the value of the OMP graceful restart timer.

https://rafaesil.medium.com/ccie-ep-16-def-sd-wan-self-efficiency-experience-sec-65c6d4412733#:~:text=The%20default%20OMP%20graceful%20restart,the%20OMP%20graceful%20restart%20timer.
Answer shold be D

questions.question_text: What are the two requirements for plug-and-play provisioning on Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN devices? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The gateway router for the WAN Edge device must be able to reach devicehelper.cisco.com.
choices.E: The WAN Edge device must have a valid certificate.
choices.C: The gateway router for the WAN Edge device must be able to reach public DNS servers.
choices.A: Devices at branch offices must be able to reach the Cisco SD-WAN vSmart controller at the headquarters site.
choices.D: The gateway router for the WAN Edge device must be able to reach ztp.viptela.com.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
devicehelper.cisco.com is for Cisco SDWAN IOX or cEdge
ztp.viptela.com is for vEdge

Selected Answer: D
In Cisco SD-WAN, the encapsulation attribute in a vRoute identifies whether the route is of type IPsec, GRE, or IP-Only, which effectively defines how the route will be treated or forwarded — this is what distinguishes the “type” of the vRoute.

The other options:
 • A. originator: Identifies the device that originated the route.
 • B. tag: Used for route filtering or classification.
 • C. origin: More relevant in traditional BGP, not specific to vRoute type.

Selected Answer: D
TLOC Disabled (DISTLOC)
Triggers to TLOC Disabled messages can be due to these probable causes:

Clear Control Connections.
Change the color on TLOC.
Change in the System IP.

questions.question_text: Which attribute identifies the type of a vRoute?
Which statement describes the requirement of integrating a secure internet gateway (SIG) with a Cisco SD-WAN Edge device?

choices.D: Attached to SIG tunnels, trackers monitor the respective SIG endpoints.
choices.C: A Cisco umbrella organization ID is needed to establish the SIG.
choices.B: Credentials for a smart account are required.
choices.A: Based on routing or policy, all customer internet traffic must be forwarded to the SIG.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When integrating Cisco SD-WAN with SIG (Secure Internet Gateway)—specifically Cisco Umbrella SIG—you must provide your Umbrella organization ID. This ID is used during the onboarding process to authenticate the tenant and link the SD-WAN fabric with the Umbrella dashboard.

⸻

Other Options Breakdown:
 • A: Not all customer internet traffic must be forwarded to the SIG. Routing or policy can selectively send traffic.
 • B: While a smart account is needed for licensing, it is not the key requirement for SIG integration.
 • D: SIG tunnels can be monitored, but that’s not the primary requirement for integration.

Selected Answer: A
Only universal answer
